name: Hoppip

attacks.name: Splashing Dodge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

flavorText: This Pokémon is blown across vast distances by the wind. It is unclear where the Hoppip of Paldea originally came from.

name: Skiploom

abilities.name: Drifting Dodge
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

attacks.name: Flowery Zephyr
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Skiploom enthusiasts can apparently tell where a Skiploom was born by the scent drifting from the flower on the Pokémon's head.

name: Jumpluff

abilities.name: Drifting Dodge
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

attacks.name: Fluffy Breeze
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Jumpluff travels on seasonal winds. Once its cotton spores run out, its journey ends, as does its life.

name: Pineco
flavorText: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.

name: Forretress ex
rules: Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Exploding Energy
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 5 Basic Grass Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. If you searched your deck in this way, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Heracross

attacks.name: Smashing Horn
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

flavorText: It loves sweet nectar. To keep all the nectar to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.

name: Tropius

attacks.name: Leaf Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tropic Breeze
attacks.text: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: It lives in tropical jungles. The bunch of fruit around its neck is delicious. The fruit grows twice a year.

name: Combee

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

flavorText: At night, Combee sleep in a group of about a hundred, packed closely together in a lump.

name: Vespiquen

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Order a Raid
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your Benched Combee and shuffle that Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck. If you can't shuffle a Combee into your deck, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It houses its colony in cells in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding.

name: Snover
flavorText: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.

name: Abomasnow

abilities.name: Freezing Disaster
abilities.text: Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) can't be healed.

flavorText: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

name: Sprigatito

attacks.name: Gather Sunlight
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.

name: Sprigatito
flavorText: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.

name: Floragato

attacks.name: Magic Whip
attacks.text: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

flavorText: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.

name: Meowscarada ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Bouquet Magic
abilities.text: You must discard a Basic Grass Energy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scratching Nails
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 120 more damage.

name: Tarountula

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

flavorText: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémon's natural enemy.

name: Tarountula
flavorText: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémon's natural enemy.

name: Spidops

attacks.name: Entangling Trap
attacks.text: Shuffle each player's Active Pokémon and all attached cards into their deck. (You choose a new Active Pokémon first.)

flavorText: It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. It takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.

name: Nymble

attacks.name: Slight Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

flavorText: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it's in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.

name: Nymble

attacks.name: Wild Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it's in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.

name: Lokix

attacks.name: Assaulting Kick
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Nymble during this turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

flavorText: When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.

name: Bramblin

attacks.name: Ride the Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.

name: Bramblin

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.

name: Brambleghast

attacks.name: Absorb Life
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dead Wood Detention
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, attacks that the Defending Pokémon uses cost ColorlessColorless more.

flavorText: It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.

name: Rellor
flavorText: This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.

name: Rellor

attacks.name: Ball Roll
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

flavorText: This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.

name: Wo-Chien ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Covetous Ivy
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon for each Prize card your opponent has taken. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Paldean Tauros

attacks.name: Raging Horns
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blaze Dash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: People call this kind of Tauros the Blaze Breed due to the hot air it snorts from its nostrils. Its three tails are intertwined.

name: Fletchinder

attacks.name: Heat Dive
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: Fletchinder scatters embers in tall grass where bug Pokémon might be hiding and then catches them as they come leaping out.

name: Talonflame

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Fiery Breeze
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 90 more damage.

flavorText: It has top-notch flying capabilities. It flies around easily, even while carrying prey that weighs more than 220 lbs.

name: Litleo

attacks.name: Blazing Destruction
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

flavorText: When Litleo are young, female Pyroar will teach them how to hunt. Once the Litleo mature, they will leave the pride and set out on their own.

name: Pyroar

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: The females of a pride work together to bring down prey. It's thanks to them that their pride doesn't starve.

name: Oricorio

abilities.name: Ardent Dancing
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from your Active Evolution Pokémon.

flavorText: This Pokémon is incredibly popular, possibly because its passionate dancing is a great match with the temperament of Paldean people.

name: Fuecoco
flavorText: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.

name: Fuecoco

attacks.name: Spacing Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.

name: Crocalor
flavorText: The combination of Crocalor's fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon's head.

name: Skeledirge ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Vitality Song
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Burning Voice
attacks.text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

name: Charcadet
flavorText: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

name: Charcadet
flavorText: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

name: Chi-Yu ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jealously Singe
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Flame Surge
attacks.text: Choose up to 3 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a Basic Fire Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Paldean Tauros

attacks.name: Raging Horns
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It swims by jetting water from its horns. The most notable characteristic of the Aqua Breed is its high body fat, which allows it to float easily.

name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Expert Splasher
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions but never more than seven feet.

name: Gyarados

attacks.name: Revengeful Storm
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, this attack does 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Berserker Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

flavorText: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.

name: Marill

attacks.name: Bubble Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can stay dry even when it plays in the water.

name: Azumarill

attacks.name: Bubble Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

flavorText: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of things in water and tell what they are.

name: Delibird

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

flavorText: It carries food all day long. There are tales about lost people who were saved by the food it had.

name: Luvdisc

attacks.name: Matching
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Supporter cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Its heart-shaped body makes it popular. In some places, you would give a Luvdisc to someone you love.

name: Eiscue

attacks.name: Frigid Block
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: On hot days, these Pokémon press their ice cube heads together and pass the time cooling each other down.

name: Quaxly

attacks.name: Apply Gel
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

flavorText: This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime.

name: Quaxly

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime.

name: Quaxwell
flavorText: These Pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.

name: Quaquaval ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Exciting Dance
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Spiral Shot
attacks.text: Put 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

name: Cetoddle

attacks.name: Avalanche
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.

name: Cetoddle

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep. Heal 60 damage from it.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.

name: Cetitan

attacks.name: Special Horn
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, this attack does 140 more damage.

flavorText: This Pokémon wanders around snowy, icy areas. It protects its body with powerful muscles and a thick layer of fat under its skin.

name: Veluza

attacks.name: Slim Screw
attacks.text: If you have no cards in your hand, this attack can be used for Water.

flavorText: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.

name: Frigibax
flavorText: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.

name: Frigibax
flavorText: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.

name: Arctibax
flavorText: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.

name: Baxcalibur

abilities.name: Super Cold
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Basic Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

flavorText: This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.

name: Chien-Pao ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shivery Chill
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may search your deck for up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Hail Blade
attacks.text: You may discard any amount of Water Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

name: Pikachu ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dynamic Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Raichu

attacks.name: Electrocharge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Lightning Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Magnetic Charge
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Lightning Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.

name: Voltorb
flavorText: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

name: Electrode
flavorText: The more energy it charges up, the faster it gets. But this also makes it more likely to explode.

name: Shinx

abilities.name: Big Roar
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

name: Shinx

attacks.name: Wild Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

name: Luxio
flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

name: Luxray

abilities.name: Swelling Flash
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in your hand and you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, you may put this Pokémon onto your Bench.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

flavorText: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.

name: Pincurchin

attacks.name: Needle Crush
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: This Pokémon generates electricity when it digests food. It uses its five hard teeth to scrape seaweed off surfaces and eat it.

name: Pincurchin

attacks.name: Stun Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Follow-Up Kerzap
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if this Pokémon used Stun Needle during your last turn.

flavorText: This Pokémon generates electricity when it digests food. It uses its five hard teeth to scrape seaweed off surfaces and eat it.

name: Pawmi
flavorText: It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.

name: Pawmo

attacks.name: Electrobullet
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: When its group is attacked, Pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.

name: Pawmot

attacks.name: Electric Fist
attacks.text: This attack also does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.

name: Tadbulb

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.

name: Tadbulb
flavorText: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.

name: Bellibolt ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jumping Press
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Paralyzing Ball
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Lightning Energy from this Pokémon to make your opponent's Active Pokémon Paralyzed.

name: Wattrel

attacks.name: United Wings
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the United Wings attack.

flavorText: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.

name: Wattrel

attacks.name: Devastating Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent shuffles their hand into their deck and draws 4 cards.

flavorText: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.

name: Kilowattrel

attacks.name: Jet Wing
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

flavorText: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.

name: Jigglypuff

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

name: Wigglytuff

abilities.name: Balloon Therapy
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Therapeutic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

flavorText: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.

name: Slowpoke

attacks.name: Tail-Fishing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. If tails, discard a card from your hand.

flavorText: It is incredibly slow and dopey. It takes five seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

name: Slowking ex
rules: Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Profound Knowledge
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Wise Headbutt
attacks.text: You may search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Misdreavus

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: This Pokémon startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.

name: Mismagius

abilities.name: Magical Flick
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may move an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.

name: Spiritomb

abilities.name: Fettered in Misfortune
abilities.text: Basic Pokémon V in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.

attacks.name: Fade Out
attacks.text: Put this Pokémon and all attached cards into your hand.

flavorText: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.

name: Gothita

attacks.name: Eerie Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: This Pokémon is normally very innocent. When it is staring at something invisible, it is unblinking and utterly silent.

name: Gothorita

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: This Pokémon will hypnotize children to put them to sleep before carrying them away. Be wary of nights when the starlight is bright.

name: Gothitelle

abilities.name: Read the Stars
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck and put 1 of them back. Put the other card on the bottom of their deck.

attacks.name: Psych Out
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

flavorText: Gothitelle unleashes psychic energy and shows opponents dreams of the universe's end. These dreams are apparently ethereal and beautiful.

name: Dedenne ex
rules: Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tail Swap
attacks.text: Move all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Wondrous Shot
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Oranguru

attacks.name: Plotter's Command
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't use that attack.

flavorText: People used to mistake Oranguru for a human when they saw it issue command after command to the other Pokémon of the forest.

name: Sandygast
flavorText: If it loses its shovel, it will stick something else— like a branch—in its head to make do until it finds another shovel.

name: Palossand

attacks.name: Earthen Power
attacks.text: If you have a Stadium in play, this attack does 80 more damage.

flavorText: The terrifying Palossand drags smaller Pokémon into its sandy body. Once its victims are trapped, it drains them of their vitality whenever it pleases.

name: Mimikyu

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon ex and Pokémon V.

attacks.name: Ghost Eye
attacks.text: Put 7 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: This Pokémon lives in dark places untouched by sunlight. When it appears before humans, it hides itself under a cloth that resembles a Pikachu.

name: Ceruledge

attacks.name: Life Sucker
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fighting Sword
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex or Pokémon V, this attack does 100 more damage.

flavorText: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.

name: Rabsca

attacks.name: Revival Blessing
attacks.text: Put a Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.

name: Tinkatink

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.

name: Tinkatink

attacks.name: Scrap Pickup
attacks.text: Put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

flavorText: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.

name: Tinkatink

attacks.name: Brutal Swing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.

name: Tinkatuff

attacks.name: Boundless Power
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

flavorText: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.

name: Tinkatuff

attacks.name: Play Rough
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Pulverizing Press
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.

name: Tinkaton

abilities.name: Gather Materials
abilities.text: You must discard a card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Special Hammer
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, this attack does 90 more damage.

flavorText: This intelligent Pokémon has a very daring disposition. It knocks rocks into the sky with its hammer, aiming for flying Corviknight.

name: Mankey
flavorText: It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.

name: Primeape

attacks.name: Pummel
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

flavorText: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.

name: Paldean Tauros

attacks.name: Raging Horns
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Combat Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: This kind of Tauros, known as the Combat Breed, is distinguished by its thick, powerful muscles and its fierce disposition.

name: Sudowoodo

attacks.name: Hit and Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

flavorText: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears more similar to rock than to vegetation.

name: Larvitar

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

flavorText: Born deep underground, this Pokémon becomes a pupa after eating enough dirt to make a mountain.

name: Pupitar
flavorText: This pupa flies around wildly by venting with great force the gas pressurized inside its body.

name: Makuhita
flavorText: It grows stronger by enduring harsh training. It is a gutsy Pokémon that can withstand any attack.

name: Hariyama

abilities.name: Arm Thrust Practice
abilities.text: All of your Pokémon take 10 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: It loves challenging others to tests of strength. It has the power to stop a train with a slap.

name: Croagunk

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

name: Toxicroak

attacks.name: Knuckle Claws
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Swaying and dodging the attacks of its foes, it weaves its flexible body in close, then lunges out with its poisonous claws.

name: Rockruff
flavorText: This Pokémon is very friendly when it's young. Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures, but it never forgets the kindness of its master.

name: Lycanroc ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Scary Fangs
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if it is Knocked Out), put 10 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

name: Passimian

attacks.name: Make the Assist
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: This Pokémon battles by throwing hard berries. It won't obey a Trainer who throws Poké Balls without skill.

name: Falinks

attacks.name: Reckless Charge Together
attacks.text: If Falinks is on your Bench, this attack does 90 more damage.

flavorText: The brass, which is the one that stands at the front and issues orders, is the strongest and smartest of the six.

name: Nacli
flavorText: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.

name: Nacli

attacks.name: Salt Coating
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

flavorText: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.

name: Naclstack

attacks.name: Salt Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

flavorText: This Pokémon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the prey's body.

name: Garganacl

abilities.name: Blessed Salt
abilities.text: During Pokémon Checkup, heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Knocking Hammer
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

flavorText: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.

name: Glimmet

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.

name: Glimmet
flavorText: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.

name: Glimmora

abilities.name: Shattering Crystal
abilities.text: When this Pokémon is Knocked Out, flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't take any Prize cards for it.

attacks.name: Poison Petals
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During Pokémon Checkup, put 6 damage counters on that Pokémon instead of 1.

flavorText: When this Pokémon detects danger, it will open up its crystalline petals and fire beams from its conical body.

name: Ting-Lu ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Cursed Land
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Pokémon in play that have any damage counters on them have no Abilities, except for Pokémon ex.

attacks.name: Land Scoop
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

name: Paldean Wooper

attacks.name: Find a Home
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.

name: Paldean Wooper
flavorText: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.

name: Paldean Clodsire ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Toxic Wetland
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if a Stadium is in play, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Poisoned.

attacks.name: Needle Bone
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, during your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Murkrow

attacks.name: Spin Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: United Wings
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the United Wings attack.

flavorText: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.

name: Honchkrow

attacks.name: Dirty Throw
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you can't, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It is merciless by nature. It is said that it never forgives the mistakes of its Murkrow followers.

name: Sneasel
flavorText: This cunning Pokémon hides under the cover of darkness, waiting to attack its prey.

name: Weavile

abilities.name: Assaulting Hunt
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to the Active Spot, you may switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokémon to the Active Spot.

flavorText: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.

name: Tyranitar

attacks.name: Rout
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dread Mountain
attacks.text: Discard the top 4 cards of your deck.

flavorText: Extremely strong, it can change the landscape. It is so insolent that it doesn't care about others.

name: Sableye

attacks.name: Night Eyes
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Unseen Claw
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 70 more damage.

flavorText: It dwells in the darkness of caves. It uses its sharp claws to dig up gems to nourish itself.

name: Seviper

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 50 more damage.

flavorText: It sharpens its swordlike tail on hard rocks. It hides in tall grass and strikes unwary prey with venomous fangs.

name: Deino

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: It can't see, so its first approach to examining things is to bite them. You will be covered in wounds until a Deino warms up to you.

name: Zweilous

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: The two heads do not get along at all. If you don't give each head the same amount of attention, they'll begin fighting out of jealousy.

name: Hydreigon

abilities.name: Tri Howl
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and attach any number of Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Discard the other cards.

flavorText: Only the central head has a brain. It is very intelligent, but it thinks only of destruction.

name: Maschiff

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiff's face.

name: Maschiff
flavorText: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiff's face.

name: Mabosstiff

attacks.name: Comeuppance
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if it is Knocked Out), put damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon equal to the damage done to this Pokémon.

flavorText: This Pokémon can store energy in its large dewlap. Mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.

name: Shroodle

attacks.name: Berry Search
attacks.text: Put a Basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.

flavorText: Though usually a mellow Pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.

name: Shroodle

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Though usually a mellow Pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.

name: Grafaiai

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Colorful Graffiti
attacks.text: You may discard as many Basic Energy cards as you like from your hand. This attack does 40 damage for each type of Basic Energy you discarded in this way.

flavorText: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.

name: Bombirdier

attacks.name: Delivery Pocket
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Dark Edge
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the Pokémon's chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.

name: Corviknight

attacks.name: Accelerate
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spinning Bird
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Corviknight can't serve as a taxi service in Paldea because the Pokémon's natural predators will attack it while it flies, endangering the customer.

name: Cufant
flavorText: Using the pointy tip of its trunk, it carves off chunks of hard rocks to eat. It is very docile and helps people with physical labor.

name: Copperajah ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Bronze Body
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Nosequake
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Orthworm

abilities.name: Nutritional Iron
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has 3 or more Metal Energy attached, it gets +100 HP.

attacks.name: Shoot Through
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.

name: Noibat
flavorText: This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from its large ears to search for fruit to eat. It mistakes Applin for its food.

name: Noivern ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Covert Flight
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dominating Echo
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Special Energy or Stadium cards from their hand.

name: Girafarig

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Though very small, the brain in its tail is still considered an important organ because it emits powerful psychic energy.

name: Farigiraf

attacks.name: Either Face
attacks.text: Choose a player. That player shuffles their hand into their deck and draws 4 cards.

flavorText: Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémon is 10 times stronger than Girafarig's.

name: Dunsparce

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: It creates mazes in dark locations. When spotted, it flees into the ground by digging with its tail.

name: Dudunsparce

attacks.name: Dig Away Flash
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. Shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

flavorText: This Pokémon uses its hard tail to make its nest by boring holes into bedrock deep underground. The nest can reach lengths of over six miles.

name: Wingull
flavorText: It soars high in the sky, riding on updrafts like a glider. It carries food tucked in its bill.

name: Pelipper

abilities.name: Hearsay
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may choose 1: put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand; or search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, put it into your hand, and then shuffle your deck.

flavorText: It is a flying transporter that carries small Pokémon in its beak. It bobs on the waves to rest its wings.

name: Slakoth

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: It sleeps for 20 hours every day. Making drowsy those that see it is one of its abilities.

name: Vigoroth

attacks.name: Sharp Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

flavorText: Its stress level rises if it cannot keep moving constantly. Too much stress makes it feel sick.

name: Slaking

abilities.name: Stir and Snooze
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Asleep, flip 2 coins instead of 1 during Pokémon Checkup. If either of them is tails, this Pokémon is still Asleep.

attacks.name: Slacker's Headstrike
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: It is the world's most slothful Pokémon. However, it can exert horrifying power by releasing pent-up energy all at once.

name: Fletchling

attacks.name: Nosedive
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: This Pokémon is normally calm, but once it enters battle, its hormonal balance changes and it becomes aggressive.

name: Rookidee

attacks.name: Send Back
attacks.text: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

flavorText: This Pokémon is brave and reckless. The white markings around a Rookidee's eyes intimidate fainthearted Pokémon.

name: Corvisquire

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

flavorText: It's said that the reason behind Corvisquire's high level of intelligence is the large size of its brain relative to those of other bird Pokémon.

name: Tandemaus

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

flavorText: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.

name: Tandemaus
flavorText: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.

name: Maushold

attacks.name: Gnaw Relentlessly
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon for each of your Maushold in play.

flavorText: They build huge nests with many rooms that are used for different purposes, such as eating and sleeping.

name: Squawkabilly ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Squawk and Seize
abilities.text: Once during your first turn, you may discard your hand and draw 6 cards. You can't use more than 1 Squawk and Seize Ability during your turn.

attacks.name: Motivate
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Flamigo

abilities.name: Insta-Flock
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 Flamigo, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: United Wings
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the United Wings attack.

flavorText: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that the energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.

name: Artazon
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may search their deck for a Basic Pokémon that doesn't have a Rule Box and put it onto their Bench. Then, that player shuffles their deck. (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes.)
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Boss's Orders (Ghetsis)
rules: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Bravery Charm
rules: The Basic Pokémon this card is attached to gets +50 HP.
Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.

name: Calamitous Snowy Mountain
rules: Whenever any player attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Basic non-Water Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Calamitous Wasteland
rules: The Retreat Cost of each Basic non-Fighting Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) is Colorless more.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Choice Belt
rules: The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon V (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.

name: Clavell
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon with 120 HP or less, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Delivery Drone
rules: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Dendra
rules: Put a card from your hand on the bottom of your deck. If you do, draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand. (If you have no other cards in your hand, you can't use this card.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Falkner
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you have a Stadium in play, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Fighting Au Lait
rules: You can use this card only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent.Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Giacomo
rules: Discard a Special Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Great Ball
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Grusha
rules: Draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand. If none of your Pokémon have any Energy attached, draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand instead.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Iono
rules: Each player shuffles their hand and puts it on the bottom of their deck. If either player put any cards on the bottom of their deck in this way, each player draws a card for each of their remaining Prize cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Practice Studio
rules: The attacks of Stage 1 Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) do 10 more damage to the opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Saguaro
rules: Choose up to 2 of your Pokémon and heal 50 damage from each of them.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Super Rod
rules: Shuffle up to 3 in any combination of Pokémon and Basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Superior Energy Retrieval
rules: You can use this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.Put up to 4 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't choose a card you discarded with the effect of this card.)
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Jet Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon, switch that Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

name: Luminous Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.If the Pokémon this card is attached to has any other Special Energy attached, this card provides Colorless Energy instead.

name: Reversal Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy.If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, and if this card is attached to an Evolution Pokémon that doesn't have a Rule Box (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes), this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 3 Energy at a time.

name: Therapeutic Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy.The Pokémon this card is attached to recovers from being Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed and can't be affected by those Special Conditions.

name: Heracross

attacks.name: Smashing Horn
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

flavorText: It loves sweet nectar. To keep all the nectar to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.

name: Tropius

attacks.name: Leaf Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tropic Breeze
attacks.text: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: It lives in tropical jungles. The bunch of fruit around its neck is delicious. The fruit grows twice a year.

name: Sprigatito

attacks.name: Gather Sunlight
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.

name: Floragato

attacks.name: Magic Whip
attacks.text: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

flavorText: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.

name: Bramblin

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.

name: Fletchinder

attacks.name: Heat Dive
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: Fletchinder scatters embers in tall grass where bug Pokémon might be hiding and then catches them as they come leaping out.

name: Pyroar

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: The females of a pride work together to bring down prey. It's thanks to them that their pride doesn't starve.

name: Fuecoco

attacks.name: Spacing Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.

name: Crocalor
flavorText: The combination of Crocalor's fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon's head.

name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Expert Splasher
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions but never more than seven feet.

name: Marill

attacks.name: Bubble Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can stay dry even when it plays in the water.

name: Eiscue

attacks.name: Frigid Block
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: On hot days, these Pokémon press their ice cube heads together and pass the time cooling each other down.

name: Quaxly

attacks.name: Apply Gel
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

flavorText: This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime.

name: Quaxwell
flavorText: These Pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.

name: Frigibax
flavorText: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.

name: Arctibax
flavorText: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.

name: Baxcalibur

abilities.name: Super Cold
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Basic Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

flavorText: This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.

name: Raichu

attacks.name: Electrocharge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Lightning Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

name: Mismagius

abilities.name: Magical Flick
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may move an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.

name: Gothorita

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: This Pokémon will hypnotize children to put them to sleep before carrying them away. Be wary of nights when the starlight is bright.

name: Sandygast
flavorText: If it loses its shovel, it will stick something else— like a branch—in its head to make do until it finds another shovel.

name: Rabsca

attacks.name: Revival Blessing
attacks.text: Put a Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.

name: Tinkatink

attacks.name: Scrap Pickup
attacks.text: Put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

flavorText: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.

name: Tinkatuff

attacks.name: Play Rough
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Pulverizing Press
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.

name: Paldean Tauros

attacks.name: Raging Horns
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Combat Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: This kind of Tauros, known as the Combat Breed, is distinguished by its thick, powerful muscles and its fierce disposition.

name: Sudowoodo

attacks.name: Hit and Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

flavorText: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears more similar to rock than to vegetation.

name: Nacli

attacks.name: Salt Coating
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

flavorText: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.

name: Paldean Wooper

attacks.name: Find a Home
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.

name: Tyranitar

attacks.name: Rout
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dread Mountain
attacks.text: Discard the top 4 cards of your deck.

flavorText: Extremely strong, it can change the landscape. It is so insolent that it doesn't care about others.

name: Grafaiai

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Colorful Graffiti
attacks.text: You may discard as many Basic Energy cards as you like from your hand. This attack does 40 damage for each type of Basic Energy you discarded in this way.

flavorText: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.

name: Orthworm

abilities.name: Nutritional Iron
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has 3 or more Metal Energy attached, it gets +100 HP.

attacks.name: Shoot Through
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.

name: Rookidee

attacks.name: Send Back
attacks.text: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

flavorText: This Pokémon is brave and reckless. The white markings around a Rookidee's eyes intimidate fainthearted Pokémon.

name: Maushold

attacks.name: Gnaw Relentlessly
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon for each of your Maushold in play.

flavorText: They build huge nests with many rooms that are used for different purposes, such as eating and sleeping.

name: Flamigo

abilities.name: Insta-Flock
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 Flamigo, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: United Wings
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the United Wings attack.

flavorText: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that the energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.

name: Farigiraf

attacks.name: Either Face
attacks.text: Choose a player. That player shuffles their hand into their deck and draws 4 cards.

flavorText: Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémon is 10 times stronger than Girafarig's.

name: Dudunsparce

attacks.name: Dig Away Flash
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. Shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

flavorText: This Pokémon uses its hard tail to make its nest by boring holes into bedrock deep underground. The nest can reach lengths of over six miles.

name: Forretress ex
rules: Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Exploding Energy
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 5 Basic Grass Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. If you searched your deck in this way, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Meowscarada ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Bouquet Magic
abilities.text: You must discard a Basic Grass Energy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scratching Nails
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 120 more damage.

name: Wo-Chien ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Covetous Ivy
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon for each Prize card your opponent has taken. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Skeledirge ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Vitality Song
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Burning Voice
attacks.text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

name: Chi-Yu ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jealously Singe
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Flame Surge
attacks.text: Choose up to 3 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a Basic Fire Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Quaquaval ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Exciting Dance
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Spiral Shot
attacks.text: Put 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

name: Chien-Pao ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shivery Chill
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may search your deck for up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Hail Blade
attacks.text: You may discard any amount of Water Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

name: Bellibolt ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jumping Press
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Paralyzing Ball
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Lightning Energy from this Pokémon to make your opponent's Active Pokémon Paralyzed.

name: Slowking ex
rules: Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Profound Knowledge
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Wise Headbutt
attacks.text: You may search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Dedenne ex
rules: Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tail Swap
attacks.text: Move all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Wondrous Shot
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Tinkaton ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Big Hammer
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each card in your hand.

attacks.name: Pulverizing Press
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Lycanroc ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Scary Fangs
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if it is Knocked Out), put 10 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

name: Annihilape ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Angry Grudge
attacks.text: Put up to 12 damage counters on this Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter you placed in this way.

name: Ting-Lu ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Cursed Land
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Pokémon in play that have any damage counters on them have no Abilities, except for Pokémon ex.

attacks.name: Land Scoop
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

name: Paldean Clodsire ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Toxic Wetland
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if a Stadium is in play, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Poisoned.

attacks.name: Needle Bone
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, during your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Copperajah ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Bronze Body
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Nosequake
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Noivern ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Covert Flight
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dominating Echo
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Special Energy or Stadium cards from their hand.

name: Squawkabilly ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Squawk and Seize
abilities.text: Once during your first turn, you may discard your hand and draw 6 cards. You can't use more than 1 Squawk and Seize Ability during your turn.

attacks.name: Motivate
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Boss's Orders (Ghetsis)
rules: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Clavell
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon with 120 HP or less, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Dendra
rules: Put a card from your hand on the bottom of your deck. If you do, draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand. (If you have no other cards in your hand, you can't use this card.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Falkner
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you have a Stadium in play, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Giacomo
rules: Discard a Special Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Grusha
rules: Draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand. If none of your Pokémon have any Energy attached, draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand instead.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Iono
rules: Each player shuffles their hand and puts it on the bottom of their deck. If either player put any cards on the bottom of their deck in this way, each player draws a card for each of their remaining Prize cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Saguaro
rules: Choose up to 2 of your Pokémon and heal 50 damage from each of them.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Super Rod
rules: Shuffle up to 3 in any combination of Pokémon and Basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Superior Energy Retrieval
rules: You can use this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.Put up to 4 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't choose a card you discarded with the effect of this card.)
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
